intro: Sesamum talbotii, commonly known as the Talbot's sesame, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Pedaliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its seeds are encased in a hard, fibrous shell, which helps in seed dispersal. Sesamum talbotii is often found in rocky soils and is relatively rare in the wild.
